titleInfo.title: Printed letter No.148 of 1863 from Lieutenant-Colonel Lewis Pelly, Acting Political Resident and Consul General in the Persian Gulf to Henry Lacon Anderson, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Remarks by Pelly regarding the slave trade in the Persian Gulf.The remarks give details of the type of slaves being brought to the Arabian coast, landing points being used, information regarding the slave trade being passed on to Pelly by his political agents, how the repositioning of naval forces could be used to restrict the export of slaves to the Gulf area and the need to ensure that opposing the slade trade does not negatively impact on other trading.The remarks also briefly make reference to the impact of piracy on the trading of goods.
